title: Last Of The Summer wine star Juliette Kaplan dies age 80
text:
Juliette starred as Pearl in the BBC comedy (Picture: Getty Images)

Last Of The Summer wine star Juliette Kaplan has died age 80.

‘Juliette Kaplan, “Our Pearl”, has finally succumbed to the cancer she has bravely battled for so long,’ her agent shared on Twitter.

‘Thank you everyone who sent their love and support to this fearless and supremely gifted actress.

‘As she said, “Ta-ta and it’s been fun”. #LastOfTheSummerWine #RIP #Pearl.’

‘Ta-ta and it’s been fun’ (Picture: Rex)

Juliette also appeared on Doctors, Brookside, EastEnders, and London’s Burning, and as Agnes Tinker in ITV soap Coronation Street in 2015.

She starred as battle-axe Pearl Sibshaw in the BBC comedy Last of the Summer Wine, from 1985 to 2010.

Juliette was born on 2 October 1939 in Bournemouth but moved with her father at the age of six-months-old to South Africa.

She later spent a year living in New York before she moved back to England to live with her mother, who enrolled her at acting school to polish up her accent.

Juliette Kaplan recently turned 80 (Picture: Getty)

The actress found fame in the 1980s on the BBC comedy, and later toured the UK in her one-woman show Pearl in which she performed as her infamous character.

In early 2015 she appeared in ITV soap Coronation Street, the grandmother of established character, Beth.

Juliette Kaplan starred alongside Thora Hird and Sarah Thomas with Jane Freeman and Kathy Staff (Picture: Getty)

On 31 July her agent took to Twitter to reveal she was ‘gravely ill’ and living in a hospice.

‘Our long-term client and good friend Juliette Kaplan is gravely ill. She has asked me to thank everyone who has sent their good wishes and, in her words, to say “ta-ta and it’s been fun”. She’s a very brave lady,’ he shared.

However on 2 October she celebrated her 80th birthday, and he added: Against all odds, the amazing Juliette Kaplan has reached her 80th birthday today!

‘Sending love and congratulations to this brave lady. We haven’t quite seen #TheLastOfTheSummerWine while our #Pearl is still keeping an eye on things!’
